g3401.definition: [μιμέομαι] middle voice from μῖμος (a "mimic"); to imitate

g3403.definition: [μιμνήσκω] a prolonged form of {{g3415}} (from which some of the tenses are borrowed); to remind, i.e. (middle voice) to recall to mind

g3404.definition: [μισέω] from a primary μῖσος (hatred); to detest (especially to persecute); by extension, to love less

g3408.definition: [μισθός] apparently a primary word; pay for service (literally or figuratively), good or bad

g3409.definition: [μισθόω] from {{g3408}}; to let out for wages, i.e. (middle voice) to hire

g3412.definition: [Μιτυλήνη] for μυτιλήνη (abounding in shellfish); Mitylene (or Mytilene), a town on the island of Lesbos

g3413.definition: [Μιχαήλ] of Hebrew origin ({{h4317}}); Michael, an archangel

g3414.definition: [μνᾶ] of Latin origin; a mna (i.e. mina), a certain weight

g3415.definition: [μνάομαι] middle voice of a derivative of {{g3306}} or perhaps of the base of {{g3145}} (through the idea of fixture in the mind or of mental grasp); to bear in mind, i.e. recollect; by implication, to reward or punish Compare {{g3403}}.

g3416.definition: [Μνάσων] of uncertain origin; Mnason, a Christian

g3417.definition: [μνεία] from {{g3415}} or {{g3403}}; recollection; by implication, recital

g3418.definition: [μνῆμα] from {{g3415}}; a memorial, i.e. sepulchral monument (burial-place)

g3419.definition: [μνημεῖον] from {{g3420}}; a remembrance, i.e. cenotaph (place of interment)

g3421.definition: [μνημονεύω] from a derivative of {{g3420}}; to exercise memory, i.e. recollect; by implication, to punish; also to rehearse

g3423.definition: [μνηστεύω] from a derivative of {{g3415}}; to give a souvenir (engagement present), i.e. betroth

g3424.definition: [μογιλάλος] from {{g3425}} and {{g2980}}; hardly talking, i.e. dumb (tongue-tied)

g3425.definition: [μόγις] adverb from a primary μόγος (toil); with difficulty

g3426.definition: [μόδιος] of Latin origin; a modius, i.e. certain measure for things dry (the quantity or the utensil)

g3427.definition: [μοί] the simpler form of {{g1698}}; to me

g3428.definition: [μοιχαλίς] a prolonged form of the feminine of {{g3432}}; an adulteress (literally or figuratively)

g3432.definition: [μοιχός] perhaps a primary word; a (male) paramour; figuratively, apostate

g3433.definition: [μόλις] probably by variation for {{g3425}}; with difficulty

g3434.definition: [Μολόχ] of Hebrew origin ({{h4432}}); Moloch (i.e. Molek), an idol

g3437.definition: [μομφή] from {{g3201}}; blame, i.e. (by implication), a fault

g3438.definition: [μονή] from {{g3306}}; a staying, i.e. residence (the act or the place)

g3441.definition: [μόνος] probably from {{g3306}}; remaining, i.e. sole or single; by implication, mere

g3444.definition: [μορφή] perhaps from the base of {{g3313}} (through the idea of adjustment of parts); shape; figuratively, nature

g3445.definition: [μορφόω] from the same as {{g3444}}; to fashion (figuratively)

g3446.definition: [μόρφωσις] from {{g3445}}; formation, i.e. (by implication), appearance (semblance or (concretely) formula)

g3447.definition: [μοσχοποιέω] from {{g3448}} and {{g4160}}; to fabricate the image of a bullock

g3448.definition: [μόσχος] probably strengthened for όσχος (a shoot); a young bullock

g3449.definition: [μόχθος] from the base of {{g3425}}; toil, i.e. (by implication) sadness

g3450.definition: [μοῦ] the simpler form of {{g1700}}; of me

g3451.definition: [μουσικός] from Μοῦσα (a Muse); "musical", i.e. (as noun) a minstrel

g3452.definition: [μυελός] perhaps a primary word; the marrow

g3453.definition: [μυέω] from the base of {{g3466}}; to initiate, i.e. (by implication) to teach

g3454.definition: [μῦθος] perhaps from the same as {{g3453}} (through the idea of tuition); a tale, i.e. fiction ("myth")

g3455.definition: [μυκάομαι] from a presumed derivative of μύζω ( to "moo"); to bellow (roar)

g3456.definition: [μυκτηρίζω] from a derivative of the base of {{g3455}} (meaning snout, as that whence lowing proceeds); to make mouths at, i.e. ridicule

g3458.definition: [μύλος] probably ultimately from the base of {{g3433}} (through the idea of hardship); a "mill", i.e. (by implication), a grinder (millstone)

g3460.definition: [Μύρα] of uncertain derivation; Myra, a place in Asia Minor

g3461.definition: [μυριάς] from {{g3463}}; a ten-thousand; by extension, a "myriad" or indefinite number

g3463.definition: [μύριοι] plural of an apparently primary word (properly, meaning very many); ten thousand; by extension, innumerably many

g3464.definition: [μύρον] probably of foreign origin (compare {{h4753}}, {{g4666}}); "myrrh", i.e. (by implication) perfumed oil

g3465.definition: [Μυσία] of uncertain origin; Mysia, a region of Asia Minor

g3466.definition: [μυστήριον] from a derivative of μύω (to shut the mouth); a secret or "mystery" (through the idea of silence imposed by initiation into religious rites)

g3467.definition: [μυωπάζω] from a compound of the base of {{g3466}} and ὤψ (the face; from {{g3700}}); to shut the eyes, i.e. blink (see indistinctly)

g3468.definition: [μώλωψ] from μῶλος ("moil"; probably akin to the base of {{g3433}}) and probably ὤψ (the face; from {{g3700}}); a mole ("black eye") or blow-mark

g3469.definition: [μωμάομαι] from {{g3470}}; to carp at, i.e. censure (discredit)

g3470.definition: [μῶμος] perhaps from {{g3201}}; a flaw or blot, i.e. (figuratively) disgraceful person

g3471.definition: [μωραίνω] from {{g3474}}; to become insipid; figuratively, to make (passively, act) as a simpleton

g3473.definition: [μωρολογία] from a compound of {{g3474}} and {{g3004}}; silly talk, i.e. buffoonery

g3474.definition: [μωρός] probably from the base of {{g3466}}; dull or stupid (as if shut up), i.e. heedless, (morally) blockhead, (apparently) absurd

g3475.definition: [Μωσεύς]   or Μωσῆς,  or Μωϋσῆςof Hebrew  origin; ({{h4872}}); Moseus, Moses, or Mouses (i.e. Mosheh), the Hebrew lawgiver

g3476.definition: [Ναασσών] of Hebrew origin ({{h5177}}); Naasson (i.e. Nachshon), an Israelite

g3477.definition: [Ναγγαί] probably of Hebrew origin (compare {{h5052}}); Nangæ (i.e. perhaps Nogach), an Israelite

g3478.definition: [Ναζαρέθ]   or Ναζαρέτ;  of uncertain derivation; Nazareth or Nazaret, a place in Palestine

g3479.definition: [Ναζαρηνός] from {{g3478}}; a Nazarene, i.e. inhabitant of Nazareth

g3480.definition: [Ναζωραῖος] from {{g3478}}; a Nazoræan, i.e. inhabitant of Nazareth; by extension, a Christian

g3481.definition: [Ναθάν] of Hebrew origin ({{h5416}}); Nathan, an Israelite

g3482.definition: [Ναθαναήλ] of Hebrew origin ({{h5417}}); Nathanaël (i.e. Nathanel), an Israelite and Christian

g3483.definition: [ναί] a primary particle of strong affirmation; yes

g3484.definition: [Ναΐν] probably of Hebrew origin (compare {{h4999}}); Nain, a place in Palestine

g3485.definition: [ναός] from a primary ναίω (to dwell); a fane, shrine, temple  Compare {{g2411}}.

g3486.definition: [Ναούμ] of Hebrew origin ({{h5151}}); Naum (i.e. Nachum), an Israelite

g3488.definition: [Νάρκισσος] a flower of the same name, from νάρκη (stupefaction, as a "narcotic"); Narcissus, a Roman

g3489.definition: [ναυαγέω] from a compound of {{g3491}} and {{g71}}; to be shipwrecked (stranded, "navigate"), literally or figuratively

g3491.definition: [ναῦς] from νάω or νέω (to float); a boat (of any size)

g3493.definition: [Ναχώρ] of Hebrew origin ({{h5152}}); Nachor, the grandfather of Abraham

g3494.definition: [νεανίας] from a derivative of {{g3501}}; a youth (up to about forty years)

g3495.definition: [νεανίσκος] from the same as {{g3494}}; a youth (under forty)

g3496.definition: [Νεάπολις] from {{g3501}} and {{g4172}}; new town; Neapolis, a place in Macedonia

g3497.definition: [Νεεμάν] of Hebrew origin ({{h5283}}); Neeman (i.e. Naaman), a Syrian

g3498.definition: [νεκρός] from an apparently primary νέκυς (a corpse); dead (literally or figuratively; also as noun)

g3499.definition: [νεκρόω] from {{g3498}}; to deaden, i.e. (figuratively) to subdue
